alert.note: Alert for Atoka; Bryan; Johnston; Marshall (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 7:36PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Johnston, northwestern Bryan, northeastern Marshall and southwestern Atoka Counties through 815 PM CDT... At 735 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Blue to 5 miles south of Tishomingo. Movement was northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Durant, Tishomingo, Caddo, Silo, Milburn, Kenefic, Armstrong, Blue, Fillmore, Little City, Nida and northeastern Lake Texoma. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
